intro: Tithymalus undulatus, commonly known as the wavy tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a hairy stem and is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
